channel.title: Error running server
channel.description:
cant start up this server...
[Launcher] Running Server... Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 10 at com.rs.utils.huffman.Huffman.init(Huffman.java:15) at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:62) Press any key to continue . . .
heres the huffman.java http://pastebin.com/NCGKdzYR
as for launcher.java, line 62 is Huffman.init();
any help is greatly appreciated.

item.title: Error running server
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

look here
Cache.STORE.getIndexes()
You have no caches stored apparently, so your server must not be reading your cache? wrong directory? something is wrong in that part.

Read full topic

item.title: Error running server
item.dc:creator: @ninja1377 ninja1377
item.description:
@ninja1377 wrote:

[Launcher] Running Server…
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
at com.rs.utils.huffman.Huffman.init(Huffman.java:15)
at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:62)
Press any key to continue . . .

lol i tried from 9 to 0 with no avail.

Read full topic

item.title: Error running server
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

1 2 3 4 KOED:

There is obviously a space/tab where it shouldn’t be.

You obviously don’t know what an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is… :palm:

Your problem is that 10 is not a reachable array index. Try lowering that array. Start from 9 and see if that works. I don’t understand what the i_# means so that might contribute to this, but I don’t know.

Just a guess.

After looking at other people problems with this exception, people set their starting indexes at 1 or so. Indexes start from 0 in java, so in for loops the first int, should look like this or something close. It should (always?) start with a 0.for (int i = 0; ...) {

Read full topic
